thread.title: Egypt's keeper Hadary wins 2017 Nations Cup best keeper award - Africa Cup of Nations 2017
thread.title_full: Egypt's keeper Hadary wins 2017 Nations Cup best keeper award - Africa Cup of Nations 2017

title: Egypt's keeper Hadary wins 2017 Nations Cup best keeper award - Africa Cup of Nations 2017
text:
Ahram Online , Sunday 5 Feb 2017 , Views:966 Egypt's goalkeeper Essam El-Hadary reacts during the 2017 Africa Cup of Nations final football match between Egypt and Cameroon at the Stade de l'Amitie Sino-Gabonaise in Libreville on February 5, 2017 AFP 
Egypt keeper Essam El-Hadary has won the best keeper award title in the 2017 Africa Cup of Nations. 
Hadary – a four time-African champion – won the title for the fourth time after previous successes in 2006, 2008 and 2010. 
The 44-year-old keeper conceded three goals in the tournament but broke the record of the longest run without conceding a goal after maintaining a clean sheet over 675 minutes in two Nations Cups before being beaten by a goal from Burkina Faso's Aristide Bance in the semi-finals. 
The Wadi Degla keeper is also the oldest player to feature in a major international tournament.
